alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 29 at 2:41PM CDT until April 01 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible with total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central Nebraska. * WHEN...From Friday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The combination of strong winds and blowing and drifting snow could lead to very difficult travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A tight gradient in snowfall totals is expected from north to south, with quickly lessening amounts south of Highway 20. However, confidence in the placement of highest amounts remains somewhat uncertain, and locally higher amounts are possible.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
